security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only installation instructions and verification commands. No executable code, no network calls, no file system writes outside its own directory. All bash commands are example snippets for users to copy and run manually.

content.value_statement: Setting up reverse engineering tools manually is time consuming and error prone. This skill provides verified installation commands for radare2, Ghidra, QEMU, GDB, and Frida on Ubuntu, macOS, WSL2, and Arch Linux.
actual_capabilities: Step-by-step installation for radare2, Ghidra, QEMU, GDB, and Frida on multiple platforms
Platform-specific guides for Ubuntu, Debian, WSL2, macOS, and Arch Linux
Sysroot configuration for ARM and ARM64 cross-compilation
Docker-based dynamic analysis setup for macOS ARM emulation
Tool verification commands to confirm successful installation
Troubleshooting guide for common installation and runtime errors
limitations: WSL2 and Ubuntu provide the most complete experience, other platforms have caveats
macOS requires Docker for full cross-architecture emulation
Native Windows support is limited, WSL2 is required
Ghidra requires manual download from official website

output_examples.input: Install radare2, QEMU, and GDB on my Ubuntu system
output: Core tools installation command: sudo apt install -y radare2 qemu-user qemu-user-static gdb-multiarch binutils-multiarch jq
ARM sysroots: sudo apt install -y libc6-armhf-cross libc6-arm64-cross libc6-dev-armhf-cross libc6-dev-arm64-cross
Install r2ghidra decompiler: r2pm init && r2pm update && r2pm -ci r2ghidra

best_practices: Use Ubuntu or WSL2 for the most complete tool compatibility
Verify tool installation after setup using the provided verification commands
Configure sysroots before attempting cross-architecture emulation
anti_patterns: Skipping sysroot configuration causes QEMU to fail with missing library errors
Running Docker containers from /tmp fails silently on macOS with Colima
Installing Ghidra without increasing MAXMEM causes out-of-memory errors on large binaries

faq.question: Which platform has the best support?
faq.answer: Ubuntu and WSL2 provide full tool compatibility with minimal configuration required.

faq.question: How much disk space is needed?
faq.answer: Core tools require approximately 2-4 GB. Ghidra and full sysroots add 3-5 GB more.

faq.question: Can I use native Windows?
faq.answer: Windows requires WSL2 for full functionality. Native Windows tools are not recommended.

faq.question: Is my data safe during analysis?
faq.answer: This skill only provides installation guidance. All analysis commands run at user discretion.

faq.question: Why does QEMU fail with exec format error?
faq.answer: Docker binfmt handlers are not registered. Run the tonistiigi/binfmt setup command.

faq.question: How is this different from manual installation?
faq.answer: This skill provides curated, tested commands that avoid common pitfalls and version conflicts.
